meanings.definition: The quality of causing avoidance or dislike.
meanings.sent1: The aversiveness of the bitter medicine made the child refuse to take it.
meanings.sent2: The aversiveness of the smell made everyone cover their noses.
meanings.sent3: The aversiveness of the rainy weather made the cat refuse to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The aversiveness of the situation was like a dark cloud hanging over them.
meanings.sent5: The aversiveness of the taste lingered in his mouth long after he had swallowed the medicine.

meanings.definition: The state of being unpleasant or repulsive.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't stand the aversiveness of the slimy texture on her skin.
meanings.sent2: The aversiveness of the decaying food in the fridge was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The aversiveness of the clown's outfit made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The aversiveness of the situation hit him like a wave of nausea.
meanings.sent5: The aversiveness of the smell filled the room, making it hard to breathe.
